snippet: People with congestive heart failure are often treated with warfarin to prevent blood clots, but a large randomized double-blinded trial has found that aspirin works just as well.
abstract: People with congestive heart failure are often treated with warfarin to prevent blood clots, but a large randomized double-blinded trial has found that aspirin works just as well.

headline.main: Aspirin Seen to Be as Effective as Warfarin
headline.print_headline: Vital Signs: Regimen: Aspirin Seen to Be as Effective as Warfarin
